instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board clean, fan, no screen, no chime
threads.message:
Hi,
i have this board, i check all rail are GOOD (no mistake).
the board start fan, i can make a PRAM (i see the fan stop and restart). no chime, nothing on screen, nothing on the external display (with keyboard external), mouse on usb (no light).
Corrupt EFI? Board clean no liquid, what is the issue?
thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board clean, fan, no screen, no chime
threads.message: Resistance to ground on CPU VCore? Is VCore present??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board clean, fan, no screen, no chime
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board clean, fan, no screen, no chime
threads.message: Yeah this could be a whole lot of things then. Inspect closely for any signs of previous liquid near SMC, BIOS, <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>, ad JTAG connector.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board clean, fan, no screen, no chime
threads.message:
i check for sign of  liquid but really nothing.
I ask to the customer, he say the mac stop work when using.
Have you an idea?
